info.title: Computer Vision Client
info.description: The Computer Vision API provides state-of-the-art algorithms to process images and return information. For example, it can be used to extract text using Read OCR, caption an image using descriptive natural language, detect objects, people, and more.

post.summary: Analyze the input image. The request either contains an image stream with any content type ['image/*', 'application/octet-stream'], or a JSON payload which includes a url property to be used to retrieve the image stream. An image stream of content type 'image/png' is returned, where the pixel values depend on the analysis mode. The returned image has the same dimensions as the input image for modes: foregroundMatting. The returned image has the same aspect ratio and same dimensions as the input image up to a limit of 16 megapixels for modes: backgroundRemoval.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The analysis mode requested.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.

parameters.name: model-version
parameters.description: Model version.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request of VectorizeText.

parameters.name: model-version
parameters.description: Model version.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.

post.summary: Run the image stitching operation against a sequence of images.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Input images urls that pass into image stitching operation.

post.summary: Run the image rectification operation against an image with 4 control points provided in the parameter.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Input image url and control points that are passed into rectification operation.

post.summary: Run the planogram matching operation against a planogram and a product understanding result.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Input to pass into the planogram matching operation.

put.summary: Run the product recognition against a model with an image.

parameters.name: modelName
parameters.description: The name of the model to run product recognition with.

parameters.name: runName
parameters.description: The name of the product recognition run.

get.summary: Get information about a specific product recognition run.

parameters.name: modelName
parameters.description: The name of the model the product recognition run belongs to.

parameters.name: runName
parameters.description: The name of the product recognition run.

delete.summary:
Delete a product recognition run. A product recognition run can be deleted if it is in the 'Succeeded' or 'Failed' states.
            
Status codes returned:
- 204: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 404: A product recognition run with the specified name was not found.

parameters.name: modelName
parameters.description: The name of the model to delete the product recognition run for.

parameters.name: runName
parameters.description: The name of the product recognition run.

get.summary: List all product recognition run of a model.

parameters.name: modelName
parameters.description: The name of the model the product recognition runs belongs to.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of product recognition runs to be skipped.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Number of product recognition runs to be returned after skipping. The maximum allowed value is 30.

post.summary: Analyze the input image. The request either contains image stream with any content type ['image/*', 'application/octet-stream'], or a JSON payload which includes an url property to be used to retrieve the image stream.

parameters.name: features
parameters.description: The visual features requested: tags, objects, caption, denseCaptions, read, smartCrops, people. This parameter needs to be specified if the parameter "model-name" is not specified.

parameters.name: model-name
parameters.description: The name of the custom trained model. This parameter needs to be specified if the parameter "features" is not specified.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en". See https://aka.ms/cv-languages for a list of supported languages.

parameters.name: smartcrops-aspect-ratios
parameters.description: A list of aspect ratios to use for smartCrops feature. Aspect ratios are calculated by dividing the target crop width by the height. Supported values are between 0.75 and 1.8 (inclusive). Multiple values should be comma-separated. If this parameter is not specified, the service will return one crop suggestion with an aspect ratio it sees fit between 0.5 and 2.0 (inclusive).

parameters.name: gender-neutral-caption
parameters.description: Boolean flag for enabling gender-neutral captioning for caption and denseCaptions features. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "false".

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.

put.summary:
Register a new dataset.
            
Status codes returned:
- 201: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 409: A dataset with the specified name already exists.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A name that can be used to uniquely identify the dataset after it has been registered.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Properties for the dataset, such as the list of URIs to the annotation files.

get.summary:
Get information about a specific dataset.
            
Status codes returned:
- 200: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 404: A dataset with the specified name was not found.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the dataset to get.

patch.summary:
Update the properties of an existing dataset.
            
Status codes returned:
- 200: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 404: A dataset with the specified name was not found.
- 412: An If-Match header was provided, but the given ETag did not match the current ETag value.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the dataset to update.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Optional ETag for the dataset to update.
If an ETag is provided, then the dataset will be updated only if its current ETag value matches the given ETag. If the ETag values don't match, then the update operation will fail with status code 412 (Precondition Failed). This indicates that the dataset has been updated since the last time information for the dataset was obtained.
If an ETag is not provided or its value is '*', then the dataset will always be updated regardless of the current ETag value.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Properties to update on the existing dataset.

delete.summary:
Unregister a dataset.
            
Status codes returned:
- 204: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 404: A dataset with the specified name was not found.
- 412: An If-Match header was provided, but the given ETag did not match the current ETag value.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the dataset to unregister.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Optional ETag for the dataset to unregister.
If an ETag is provided, then the dataset will be unregistered only if its current ETag value matches the given ETag. If the ETag values don't match, then the unregister operation will fail with status code 412 (Precondition Failed). This indicates that the dataset has been updated since the last time information for the dataset was obtained.
If an ETag is not provided or its value is '*', then the dataset will always be unregistered regardless of the current ETag value.

get.summary:
Get a list of datasets that have been registered.
            
Status codes returned:
- 200: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of datasets to be skipped.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Number of datasets to be returned after skipping. The maximum allowed value is 30.

put.summary:
Start training a custom model.
            
Status codes returned:
- 201: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 409: A model with the specified name already exists.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A name that can be used to uniquely identify the model after it has been created.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Properties for the model, such as the name of the dataset to use to train the model.

get.summary:
Get information about a specific model.
            
Status codes returned:
- 200: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 404: A model with the specified name was not found.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the model to get.

delete.summary:
Delete a custom model. A model can be deleted if it is in one of the 'Succeeded', 'Failed', or 'Canceled' states.
If a model is in the 'NotStarted' or 'Training' state, cancel training and wait for cancellation to finish before deleting the model.
            
Status codes returned:
- 204: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 404: A model with the specified name was not found.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the model to delete.

get.summary:
Get a list of the available models.
            
Status codes returned:
- 200: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of models to be skipped.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Number of models to be returned after skipping. The maximum allowed value is 30.

post.summary:
Cancel model training.
            
Status codes returned:
- 202: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 404: A model with the specified name was not found.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the model to cancel training.

put.summary:
Evaluate an existing model.
            
Status codes returned:
- 201: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 409: An evaluation with the specified name already exists.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the model to evaluate.

parameters.name: evaluationName
parameters.description: A name that can be used to uniquely identify the evaluation after it has been created.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Properties for the evaluation, such as the name of the dataset to use to test the model.

get.summary:
Get information about a specific model evaluation.
            
Status codes returned:
- 200: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 404: A model  evaluation with the specified name was not found.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the model to get the evaluation for.

parameters.name: evaluationName
parameters.description: The name of the model evaluation to get.

delete.summary:
Delete a model evaluation. A model evaluation can be deleted if it is in the 'Succeeded' or 'Failed' states.
            
Status codes returned:
- 204: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.
- 404: A model evaluation with the specified name was not found.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the model to delete the evaluation for.

parameters.name: evaluationName
parameters.description: The name of the model evaluation to delete.

get.summary:
Get a list of the available evaluations for a model.
            
Status codes returned:
- 200: Operation completed successfully.
- 400: The request was malformed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the model to get evaluations for.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of evaluations to be skipped.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Number of evaluations to be returned after skipping. The maximum allowed value is 30.

AdultMatch.description: An object describing adult content match.

isMatch.description: A value indicating if the image is matched adult content.

confidence.description: A value indicating the confidence level of matched adult content.

AdultResult.description: An object describing whether the image contains adult-oriented content and/or is racy.

BoundingBox.description: A bounding box for an area inside an image.

x.description: Left-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.

y.description: Top-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.

w.description: Width measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

h.description: Height measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

CaptionResult.description: A brief description of what the image depicts.

confidence.description: The level of confidence the service has in the caption.

CropRegion.description: A region identified for smart cropping. There will be one region returned for each requested aspect ratio.

aspectRatio.description: The aspect ratio of the crop region.

DenseCaption.description: A brief description of what the image depicts.

confidence.description: The level of confidence the service has in the caption.

Description.description: A brief description of what the image depicts.

confidence.description: The level of confidence the service has in the caption.

DescriptionResult.description: A list of descriptions sorted by confidence level.

values.description: A list of descriptions sorted by confidence level.

DetectedObject.description: Describes a detected object in an image.

tags.description: Classification confidences of the detected object.

DetectedPerson.description: A person detected in an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score of having observed the person in the image, as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

DocumentLanguage.description: An object representing the detected language for a given text span.

spans.description: Location of the text elements in the concatenated content the language applies to.

languageCode.description: Detected language. Value may an ISO 639-1 language code (ex. "en", "fr") or BCP 47 language tag (ex. "zh-Hans").

confidence.description: Confidence of correctly identifying the language.

DocumentLine.description: A content line object consisting of an adjacent sequence of content elements, such as words and selection marks.

content.description: Concatenated content of the contained elements in reading order.

spans.description: Location of the line in the reading order concatenated content.

DocumentPage.description: The content and layout elements extracted from a page from the input.

height.description: The height of the image/PDF in pixels/inches, respectively.

width.description: The width of the image/PDF in pixels/inches, respectively.

angle.description: The general orientation of the content in clockwise direction, measured in degrees between (-180, 180].

pageNumber.description: 1-based page number in the input document.

spans.description: Location of the page in the reading order concatenated content.

lines.description: Extracted lines from the page, potentially containing both textual and visual elements.

DocumentSpan.description: Contiguous region of the concatenated content property, specified as an offset and length.

offset.description: Zero-based index of the content represented by the span.

length.description: Number of characters in the content represented by the span.

DocumentStyle.description: An object representing observed text styles.

spans.description: Location of the text elements in the concatenated content the style applies to.

confidence.description: Confidence of correctly identifying the style.

DocumentWord.description:
A word object consisting of a contiguous sequence of characters. For non-space delimited languages,
such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean, each character is represented as its own word.

confidence.description: Confidence of correctly extracting the word.

ErrorResponse.description: Response returned when an error occurs.

FixtureApiModel.description: Describes a fixture in a planogram.

x.description: Left offset from the origin, in unit of in inches or centimeters.

y.description: Top offset from the origin, in unit of in inches or centimeters.

ImageAnalysisResult.description: Describe the combined results of different types of image analysis.

ImageMetadataApiModel.description: The image metadata information such as height and width.

width.description: The width of the image in pixels.

height.description: The height of the image in pixels.

ImagePredictionResult.description: Describes the prediction result of an image.

ImageRectificationControlPointsApiModel.description: Four corner control points for rectification. The origin is at top-left.

ImageUrl.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.

url.description: Publicly reachable URL of an image.

ObjectsResult.description: Describes detected objects in an image.

PeopleResult.description: An object describing whether the image contains people.

PlanogramApiModel.description: Describes the planogram for planogram matching operations.

products.description: List of products in the planogram.

fixtures.description: List of fixtures in the planogram.

positions.description: List of positions in the planogram.

PlanogramMatchingRequestApiModel.description: Input to pass into the planogram matching operation.

PlanogramMatchingResultApiModel.description: Results from the planogram matching operation.

matchingResultPerPosition.description: The matched detected object information for each planogram position.

PositionApiModel.description: Describes a product position in a planogram.

fixtureId.description: Id of the fixture that the product is on.

x.description: Left offset from the origin, in unit of in inches or centimeters.

y.description: Top offset from the origin, in unit of in inches or centimeters.

PositionMatchingResultApiModel.description: Paired planogram position ID and corresponding detected object from product understanding result.

positionId.description: The position ID from the planogram matched to the corresponding detected object.

ProductApiModel.description: Describes a product in the planogram.

runName.description: Read only. The name that is used to uniquely identify the product recognition run.

modelName.description: Read only. The model to run product recognition against.

createdDateTime.description: Read only. The date and time when the product recognition run was first created, in UTC.

updatedDateTime.description: Read only. The date and time when the product recognition run was last updated, in UTC.

status.description: Read only. The current state of the product recognition run.

ProductRecognitionApiModelCollectionApiM.description: Contains an array of results that may be paginated.

nextLink.description: A link to the next set of paginated results, if there are more results available; not present otherwise.

ProductRecognitionResultApiModel.description: Results from the product understanding operation.

ReadResult.description: The results of an Read operation.

stringIndexType.description: The method used to compute string offset and length, possible values include: 'textElements', 'unicodeCodePoint', 'utf16CodeUnit' etc.

content.description: Concatenate string representation of all textual and visual elements in reading order.

values.description: Recommended regions for cropping the image.

Tag.description: An entity observation in the image, along with the confidence score.

confidence.description: The level of confidence that the entity was observed.

TagsResult.description: A list of tags with confidence level.

values.description: A list of tags with confidence level.

Dataset.description: Describes a dataset, which represents a set of images and annotations that can be used for training or testing a model.

annotationKind.description:
The kind of annotations contained in the annotation files.
For example, "ImageClassification" to specify that the annotation file contain object labels for training or testing a multiclass image classification model.

annotationFileUris.description:
List of absolute URIs to annotation files, each of which must be stored as a blob in an Azure Storage blob container.
Each file must follow the COCO format for the specified AnnotationKind, with each image path being an absolute URI to a blob in a blob container.
The Computer Vision resource must have permission to read the annotation files and all referenced image files.
This can be done by turning on System managed identities for the Computer Vision resource, then assigning the identity to a role that has permission to read from the blob container containing the annotation and image files.

customProperties.description: Dictionary of arbitrary key-value pairs for use by the application. A maximum of 10 key-value pairs are allowed.

name.description: Read only. The name that is used to uniquely identify the dataset.

createdDateTime.description: Read only. The date and time when the dataset was first registered, in UTC.

updatedDateTime.description: Read only. The date and time when the dataset was last updated, in UTC.

eTag.description: Read only. The latest ETag for the dataset. May be used with the 'If-Match' header when updating or deleting a dataset.

DatasetApiModelCollectionApiModel.description: Contains an array of results that may be paginated.

nextLink.description: A link to the next set of paginated results, if there are more results available; not present otherwise.

Model.description: Describes a training run for training a custom model.

name.description: Read only. The name that is used to uniquely identify the training run.

createdDateTime.description: Read only. The date and time when the training run was first created, in UTC.

updatedDateTime.description: Read only. The date and time when the training run was last updated, in UTC.

status.description: Read only. The current state of the training run.

trainingCostInMinutes.description: Read only. Actual training cost consumed, in minutes. Present only if the training run as completed.

ModelApiModelCollectionApiModel.description: Contains an array of results that may be paginated.

nextLink.description: A link to the next set of paginated results, if there are more results available; not present otherwise.

ModelEvaluation.description: Describes an evaluation run for evaluating the accuracy of a model using a test set.

name.description: Read only. The name that is used to uniquely identify the evaluation run.

modelName.description: Read only. The model to evaluate.

createdDateTime.description: Read only. The date and time when the evaluation run was first created, in UTC.

updatedDateTime.description: Read only. The date and time when the evaluation run was last updated, in UTC.

status.description: Read only. The current state of the evaluation run.

ModelEvaluationApiModelCollectionApiMode.description: Contains an array of results that may be paginated.

nextLink.description: A link to the next set of paginated results, if there are more results available; not present otherwise.

ModelEvaluationParameters.description: Parameters for specifying how a model is evaluated.

testDatasetName.description: The dataset name used for testing.

ModelPerformance.description: Performance metrics for a custom trained model.

accuracyTop1.description: Read only. For multiclass classification models. The proportion of test samples where the ground truth class matches the predicted class.

accuracyTop5.description: Read only. For multiclass classification models. The proportion of test samples where the ground truth class is in the top five predicted classes.

averagePrecision.description: Read only. A measure of the model performance, it summarizes the precision and recall at different confidence thresholds.

calibrationECE.description: Read only. For multiclass classification models. Expected calibration error.

meanAveragePrecision30.description: Read only. For object detection models. Mean average precision at a threshold of 30%.

meanAveragePrecision50.description: Read only. For object detection models. Mean average precision at a threshold of 50%.

meanAveragePrecision75.description: Read only. For object detection models. Mean average precision at a threshold of 75%.

tagPerformance.description: Read only. Performance metrics for each tag recognized by the model.

ModelTagPerformance.description: Performance metrics for each tag recognized by a custom trained model.

accuracy.description: Read only. For multiclass models. Tag accuracy.

averagePrecision50.description: Read only. For object detection models. Average precision at a threshold of 50%.

sasToken.description: Optional. The sas token to access container. Only needed when Kind = Sas.

TrainingParameters.description: Parameters for specifying how a training run trains a custom model.

trainingDatasetName.description: The dataset name used for training.

timeBudgetInHours.description:
Time budget for training, in hours. The minimum allowed value is 1, and the maximum allowed value is 336 hours for GenericClassifier, 1344 hours for GenericDetector.
This is the maximum amount of compute time that will be spent to train the model.

post.summary: Analyze the input image. The request either contains an image stream with any content type ['image/*', 'application/octet-stream'], or a JSON payload which includes a url property to be used to retrieve the image stream. An image stream of content type 'image/png' is returned, where the pixel values depend on the analysis mode. The returned image has the same dimensions as the input image for modes: foregroundMatting. The returned image has the same aspect ratio and same dimensions as the input image up to a limit of 16 megapixels for modes: backgroundRemoval.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The analysis mode requested.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An image stream.

parameters.name: model-version
parameters.description: Model version.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An image stream.

post.summary: Analyze the input image. The request either contains image stream with any content type ['image/*', 'application/octet-stream'], or a JSON payload which includes an url property to be used to retrieve the image stream.

parameters.name: features
parameters.description: The visual features requested: tags, objects, caption, denseCaptions, read, smartCrops, people. This parameter needs to be specified if the parameter "model-name" is not specified.

parameters.name: model-name
parameters.description: The name of the custom trained model. This parameter needs to be specified if the parameter "features" is not specified.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en". See https://aka.ms/cv-languages for a list of supported languages.

parameters.name: smartcrops-aspect-ratios
parameters.description: A list of aspect ratios to use for smartCrops feature. Aspect ratios are calculated by dividing the target crop width by the height. Supported values are between 0.75 and 1.8 (inclusive). Multiple values should be comma-separated. If this parameter is not specified, the service will return one crop suggestion with an aspect ratio it sees fit between 0.5 and 2.0 (inclusive).
